item.title: Kubernetes DNS problems in heterogeneous clusters
item.description: The symptoms Pods will not correctly perform DNS resolution, seemingly at random. One day everything is fine, the next day everything is on fire. Kube-dns pods show some restarts (2-3) in the last few days, these restarts are correlated to the problems, and indicate a bad restart. This means that SOMETIMES, when the kube-dns pod restarted, it did so in a bad state or configuration. Logs on kube-dns failed containers show an upstream DNS resolver of 127.
